required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy of Pantoprazole in Patients Older Than 12 Years Who Have Symptoms of Non-Erosive Reflux Disease (NERD) or Erosive Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (eGERD)
clinical_study.official_title: Pantoprazole 20 mg/40 mg for the Treatment of Gastroesophageal Reflux Disease (GERD)

brief_summary.textblock: The aim of the study was to evaluate the effect of 7 days treatment with Pantoprazole 40 mg and 20 mg on symptoms in patients with NERD (non-erosive reflux disease) or eGERD (erosive gastroesophageal reflux disease) in clinical practice. During the study, the patients had to complete a short version of a patient-orientated, self-assessed reflux questionnaire (ReQuest™ in Practice).

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of General Well-being During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=Excellent to 10=Extremely bad

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Acid Complaints During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=None to 10=Extremely strong

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Upper Abdominal/Stomach Complaints During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=None to 10=Extremely strong

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Lower Abdominal/Digestive Complaints During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=None to 10=Extremely strong

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Nausea During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=None to 10=Extremely strong

primary_outcome.measure: Patient's Assessment of Sleep Disturbances During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
primary_outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=None to 10=Extremely strong

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of the Efficacy of Pantoprazole 20 mg/40 mg at Final Visit
Assessment of the Tolerability of Pantoprazole 20 mg/40 mg at Final Visit

intervention.description: Observational, non-interventional study (NIS). The physician decided about dosage according to individual needs (20 or 40 mg pantoprazole, once daily).

criteria.textblock:
Main inclusion criteria:
- Outpatients with erosive gastro-esophageal reflux disease (eGERD according to Los Angeles classification grade A-D) or non-erosive reflux disease (NERD)
Main exclusion criteria:
- Criteria as defined in the Summary of Product Characteristics (Chapter 4.3)

overall_official.last_name: Dr. Thomas D. Bethke, MD, MBA

measure.title: Age
measure.description: The measured value is related to the number of 1977 subjects (= valid cases). This number differs from the overall number of baseline participants due to missing data for 18 subjects.

outcome.title: Patient's Assessment of General Well-being During the Last 24 Hours (Diaries; ReQuest™ in Practice)
outcome.description: Assessment on a scale: Severity from 0=Excellent to 10=Extremely bad
outcome.population: All patients included and treated, intention to treat, missing values not imputed ('as observed'). Number of valid cases: Day 0 = 1769 Day 1 = 1760 Day 2 = 1761 Day 3 = 1751 Day 4 = 1749 Day 5 = 1742 Day 6 = 1747

certain_agreements.pi_employee: Principal Investigators are NOT employed by the organization sponsoring the study.
certain_agreements.restrictive_agreement: There is NOT an agreement between Principal Investigators and the Sponsor (or its agents) that restricts the PI's rights to discuss or publish trial results after the trial is completed.
